interactions.description: Taking together may increase risk of stomach bleeding and reduce aspirin's heart protection benefits
interactions.recommendation: Take ibuprofen at least 8 hours before or 30 minutes after aspirin. Consider acetaminophen instead.

interactions.description: Significantly increases bleeding risk, potentially life-threatening
interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination unless specifically prescribed by doctor. Requires close monitoring.

interactions.description: May reduce blood pressure control and increase risk of kidney problems
interactions.recommendation: Use lowest effective ibuprofen dose. Monitor blood pressure and kidney function.

interactions.description: Both are NSAIDs - combining increases stomach bleeding and cardiovascular risks
interactions.recommendation: Do not take together. Choose one NSAID only.

interactions.description: Regular acetaminophen use may increase warfarin's blood-thinning effect
interactions.recommendation: Occasional use OK. Regular use requires INR monitoring.

interactions.description: Both increase risk of stomach ulcers and bleeding
interactions.recommendation: Use with caution. Consider stomach protection (e.g., omeprazole).

interactions.description: SSRIs with NSAIDs increase bleeding risk, especially GI bleeding
interactions.recommendation: Use lowest effective NSAID dose. Watch for unusual bleeding or bruising.

interactions.description: Increases bleeding risk when combined with SSRIs
interactions.recommendation: Monitor for bleeding. Consult doctor before combining.

interactions.description: Increases risk of serotonin syndrome and seizures
interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. Seek alternatives or use with extreme caution under doctor supervision.

interactions.description: Risk of serotonin syndrome (confusion, rapid heart rate, fever, seizures)
interactions.recommendation: Avoid if possible. If necessary, use lowest doses with close monitoring.

interactions.description: May cause dangerously high potassium levels (hyperkalemia)
interactions.recommendation: Regular potassium level monitoring required. Avoid potassium supplements.

interactions.description: Lisinopril may enhance blood sugar lowering effect
interactions.recommendation: Monitor blood glucose. May need metformin dose adjustment.

interactions.description: Increases sedation and respiratory depression risk
interactions.recommendation: Use together only as prescribed. Avoid driving. Monitor for excessive drowsiness.

interactions.description: Dangerous combination - severe sedation, respiratory depression, death possible
interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. If prescribed together, use extreme caution and lowest doses.

interactions.description: Excessive sedation and impaired coordination
interactions.recommendation: Avoid taking together. Do not operate machinery or drive.

interactions.description: May reduce clopidogrel effectiveness in preventing blood clots
interactions.recommendation: Consider alternative PPI (pantoprazole) or H2 blocker.

interactions.description: May reduce levothyroxine absorption
interactions.recommendation: Take levothyroxine on empty stomach, omeprazole 30-60 minutes before meal.

interactions.description: Many antibiotics alter warfarin metabolism, affecting INR
interactions.recommendation: Increase INR monitoring during and after antibiotic course.

interactions.description: NSAIDs may increase methotrexate toxicity (kidney, liver, blood)
interactions.recommendation: Use acetaminophen instead. If NSAIDs needed, monitor closely.

interactions.description: Diuretics may cause low potassium, increasing digoxin toxicity risk
interactions.recommendation: Monitor potassium and digoxin levels regularly.

interactions.description: Amlodipine increases simvastatin levels, raising muscle damage risk
interactions.recommendation: Limit simvastatin to 20mg daily when taking amlodipine.

interactions.description: SSRIs increase bleeding risk with aspirin
interactions.recommendation: Monitor for unusual bleeding or bruising.

interactions.description: Increased risk of stomach ulcers and GI bleeding
interactions.recommendation: Consider PPI protection. Watch for black stools or stomach pain.

interactions.description: May increase serotonin syndrome risk and sedation
interactions.recommendation: Use with caution. Watch for confusion, agitation, rapid heartbeat.

interactions.description: Increased risk of serotonin syndrome
interactions.recommendation: Common combination but requires monitoring. Report unusual symptoms immediately.

interactions.description: Significantly increases seizure risk
interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. Choose alternative pain medication.

interactions.description: Increases serotonin syndrome and seizure risk
interactions.recommendation: Avoid if possible. Requires close monitoring if used together.

interactions.description: Beta-blockers may mask low blood sugar symptoms and prolong hypoglycemia
interactions.recommendation: Monitor blood glucose more frequently. Be aware of hypoglycemia signs.

interactions.description: Beta-blockers may reduce albuterol effectiveness and trigger bronchospasm
interactions.recommendation: Avoid non-selective beta-blockers. Consider cardioselective alternative.

interactions.description: Calcium reduces levothyroxine absorption
interactions.recommendation: Separate doses by at least 4 hours.

interactions.description: Iron significantly reduces levothyroxine absorption
interactions.recommendation: Take at least 4 hours apart.

interactions.description: High vitamin D may increase calcium, increasing digoxin toxicity risk
interactions.recommendation: Monitor calcium and digoxin levels if taking high-dose vitamin D.

interactions.description: Risk of serotonin syndrome; St. John's Wort also reduces many drug levels
interactions.recommendation: Do not combine. Choose one or the other.

interactions.description: May increase bleeding risk
interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination or monitor INR closely.

interactions.description: Chronic alcohol use with acetaminophen increases liver damage risk
interactions.recommendation: Limit acetaminophen to 2g/day with regular alcohol use. Avoid if heavy drinking.

interactions.description: Increases lactic acidosis risk, especially with heavy drinking
interactions.recommendation: Avoid excessive alcohol. Limit to moderate consumption.
